title: 103_s1726
content: The East Saint Louis Jefferson National Expansion Memorial Architectural Design Competition Act authorizes a design competition for the architectural design of the memorial. Establishment of a commission composed of 7 members appointed by the Secretary of the Interior, with two members representing the Saint Louis, Missouri community, two representing the East Saint Louis, Illinois community, and two representing other persons. The Secretary appoints members of the commission within 90 days of enacting the Act. Members are selected from disinterested persons who are experts in architectural design to serve as professional advisors to the Commission. The commission members are appointed for life and vacancies are filled in the same manner as the original appointment. The commission selects a Chairperson and Vice Chairperson from among its members. Meetings begin with an initial meeting where the Chairperson and Vice Chairperson are chosen. The Secretary schedules and calls the first meeting within 30 days of all commission members being appointed. Subsequent meetings are called by the Chairperson. Members serve without compensation but are allowed travel expenses. Employees of agencies under Chapter 57 of Title 5, United States Code, are authorized travel expenses, including per diem, while away from their homes or regular places of business for service performance. The Chairperson of the commission may appoint staff without regard to civil service laws and regulations. The commission may appoint and terminate an executive director and additional personnel as necessary to perform its duties. The employment of an executive director is subject to confirmation by the commission. The Chairperson has the authority to set the compensation for the executive director and other personnel without regard to regulations. The commission has the authority to set compensation for the executive director and other personnel without regard to specific provisions in the United States Code. The commission may detail government employees to the commission without reimbursement, and procurement of temporary services can be done by the Chairperson under specific provisions in the United States Code. The commission has the power to obtain information directly from federal agencies as necessary to carry out its duties under the Act. Upon request of the Chairperson, the head of a department or agency shall furnish information to the commission. The commission may use United States mails in the same manner and under the same conditions as other departments and agencies of the Federal Government. The commission may accept, use, and dispose of gifts. The commission shall conduct an architectural competition to solicit design proposals for a museum to be built on the East Saint Louis portion of the Jefferson National Expansion Memorial. The appointed member shall organize, manage, and direct the competition, identify potential jurors, and appoint jurors. The commission shall conduct a study into funding mechanisms for the development, construction, and maintenance of the museum identified in the previous section. A report with recommendations must be submitted to the President and Congress within 18 months of this Act's enactment, detailing findings and conclusions. The commission's findings and conclusions regarding the museum and possible funding mechanisms will be submitted in a report to the President and Congress within 18 months of the Act's enactment. The East Saint Louis Jefferson National Expansion Memorial Architectural Design Competition Act of 1994 authorizes $300,000 for implementation. This Act establishes an architectural design competition for the memorial. SEC. 2. Architectural competition authorized by the Secretary of the Interior in cooperation with the National Endowment for the Arts for a museum in East Saint Louis. Funding study to identify possible sources. SEC. 3. Authorization of appropriations not to exceed $500,000.
